channel.title: 639 IP Address HELP!

item.title: 639 IP Address HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Sunbred_Rush Sunbred Rush
item.description:
@Sunbred_Rush wrote:

[quote=“Remake, post:9, topic:478308”][quote author=Sunbred Rush link=topic=596503.msg4203497#msg4203497 date=1358569907]

portforwarding has nothing to do with your server files.
http://portforward.com/
^^ all you need to know. Then just run your server.

I have done all of that already. So you’re saying just upload the client through mediafire or dropbox now? And people can play on it? Also, that I don’t need to go into my client/source or whatever to enter in a new ip?
[/quote]
You need to change the ip in your client to your ip if you want other people to log in using it.
For you, it must be set to 127.0.0.1 .[/quote]

I stopped trying to pf it a while ago, but
I just realized how moronic I am…you said it’s in the client…it’s fucking client sided

I feel like a spaz dafukkkq

Read full topic

item.title: 639 IP Address HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Remake Remake
item.description:
@Remake wrote:

[quote=“Sunbred Rush, post:8, topic:478308”][quote author=Remake link=topic=596503.msg4203421#msg4203421 date=1358562139]
portforwarding has nothing to do with your server files.
http://portforward.com/
^^ all you need to know. Then just run your server.
[/quote]

I have done all of that already. So you’re saying just upload the client through mediafire or dropbox now? And people can play on it? Also, that I don’t need to go into my client/source or whatever to enter in a new ip?[/quote]
You need to change the ip in your client to your ip if you want other people to log in using it.
For you, it must be set to 127.0.0.1 .

Read full topic

item.title: 639 IP Address HELP!

item.description:
@Sunbred_Rush wrote:

Host Gushers:

Are you trying to put your no-ip in there so you can put it online?

Lets start from here:
I’ve setup and ip address with the title RSPS

Then according to all the yt videos and things I’ve read my server is magically online?

Remake:

What exactly are you trying to do?

I want to be able to have it portforwarded so I can set this up on any random website that hosts webclients.

item.title: 639 IP Address HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Sunbred_Rush Sunbred Rush
item.description:
@Sunbred_Rush wrote:

Whadufuq do I Do!?

I’m using my linksys router so 192.168…

MessageBuilder bldr = new MessageBuilder(10, PacketType.VAR_SHORT);
	player.write(bldr.toMessage());
}

public static void sendLobbyResponse(Player player) {
	MessageBuilder bldr = new MessageBuilder();
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeShort(30); // member days left
	bldr.writeShort(1); // recovery questions
	bldr.writeShort(0); // unread messages
	bldr.writeShort(3229); // 3229 - lastDays
	int ipHash = Misc.IPAddressToNumber("WHAT THE FUCK GOES HERE???");
	bldr.writeInt(ipHash); // last ip
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 3); // email status (0 - no email, 1 - pending
	// parental confirmation, 2 - pending
	// confirmation, 3 - registered)
	bldr.writeShort(0);
	bldr.writeShort(0);
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.putGJString(player.getUsername());
	bldr.writeByte((byte) 0);
	bldr.writeInt(1);
	bldr.writeShort(1); // current world id
	bldr.putGJString("WHAT THE FUCK GOES HERE!?!?!?");
	MessageBuilder lobbyResponse = new MessageBuilder();
	lobbyResponse.writeByte((byte) bldr.position());
	lobbyResponse.writeBytes(bldr.getBuffer());
	player.getConnection().write(lobbyResponse.toMessage());
}

public static void removeGroundItem(Player player, Location tile, Item item) {
	if (tile == null || item == null || player == null
			|| player.getRegion().getLastMapRegion() == null) {
		return;
	}
	int deltaX = tile.getX() - (tile.getRegionX() << 3);
	int deltaY = tile.getY() - (tile.getRegionY() << 3);
	MessageBuilder bldr = new MessageBuilder(59);
	if (!updateTilePosition(player, tile))
